content: My cousins and friends from Korea visit me with full of excitement and high expectations for NYC and they land at JFK. That is their first bewilderment. Their eyes start to twinkler again when we get on BQE driving towards Manhattan and see the skyscrapers and iconic towers. And then we get on MTA to visit those towers and their second bewilderment show up on their faces. They just can't believe what they see; the smell, the trash, the unfinished and soot covered tunnels and walls. And the jerky movement of train and the fact that they must hold on to the poles with your dear life and fight for the spot. Apparently Korean subways run so smoothly people fall asleep standing up and not holding onto anything.
